cab.content: rG.T. 395.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W. 10th,April, 1917.RULES AS TO-;WOMEN TRAVELLIKG. (Eoferer.ce Paper G.T.-371.)In reference to. the above subject, the First Sea Lord of the Admiralty has suggested that the War Cabinet should give a general ruling to the effect that the opportunity of empty transports going to Canada, should be utilised for sending women and children who desire to go there and will not return to this country during the ;War.This rule only to take effect in the case of transports which the Admiralty can escort through the submarine danger zone.(Initialled) M.P.A.H.
